newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit weakens on strong offshore dollar bids.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit weakens on strong offshore dollar bids.

text.p: The ringgit weakened against the dollar in Asian trading, breaking through the 2.5200 level on strong bids for the dollar by offshore players.
Dealers said lack of central bank presence helped push the dollar/ringgit to a high of 2.5235.

"Dollar/ringgit remains biddish and could test the 2.5250 level during London time," said a dealer with a European bank in Kuala Lumpur. "There was some profit-taking earlier but offshore players are bidding again around 2.5230."
At 1000 GMT, ringgit was quoted at 2.5232/42 a dollar. It closed at 2.5195/5205 in Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday.
Fearing intervention by Bank Negara, offshore players were earlier cashing in their profits after clearing stop-losses above 2.5200, dealers said.
They said that though no central bank presence has been detected so far, it was likely to support the ringgit around 2.5250 level.
Dealers said the ringgit remained under pressure due to continued demand demand by offshore parties ahead of the mid-year book closing.
Dollar/ringgit bids are expected to appear more strongly later, particularly with no sign of short-end swaps firming up, they said.
